thread.title: Midnight Special: Nissan Adds Midnight Edition Rogue, Murano, and Pathfinder
thread.title_full: Midnight Special: Nissan Adds Midnight Edition Rogue, Murano, and Pathfinder

author: Greg Fink
title: Midnight Special: Nissan Adds Midnight Edition Rogue, Murano, and Pathfinder
text:
-Nissan announced the expansion of its Midnight Edition package to three of its crossover SUVs— the Rogue , the Murano , and the Pathfinder —at the Chicago auto show . The package, which is already available on the Maxima full-size sedan and was previously offered on the Juke subcompact crossover SUV, brings a host of dark-colored features to the three high-riding hatches, including black wheels, mirror caps, and splash guards. 
-Available on the $26,180 midline Rogue SV at an additional cost of $990, the Rogue Midnight Edition also sports a handful of model-specific touches such as black roof rails and crossbars, a rear bumper protector, and illuminated kick plates. Meanwhile, Murano customers interested in the Midnight Edition package will have to spring for the top-of-the-line Murano Platinum at $40,120 and be willing to drop an extra $1195 to equip their Murano with the Midnight Edition’s darker kit, which also includes black roof rails.
- - 2017 Nissan Rogue Hybrid Priced! - Extra Vanly: Nissan’s Diesel-Powered 4×4 NV Cargo X Concept - Nissan NV1500 / 2500 / 3500: Full Info, Pricing, Reviews, Photos, and More - -As with the Murano, opting for the Pathfinder Midnight Edition requires the Platinum trim. It is a $1195 proposition added to the Pathfinder Platinum’s price of $43,010. Pathfinder Midnight Editions, however, also include a host of model-specific features such as a black spoiler, illuminated kick plates, and a chrome rear bumper protector. Both the Murano Midnight Edition and the Pathfinder Midnight Edition are available now, while the Rogue Midnight Edition goes on sale in March.
